column8: Description
str
Sheathe/unsheathe your main arm.
Displays vital information about your character, including attributes, currently equipped gear, titles, and more.
View and manage the actions and traits available to your character, as well as set them to your hotbars.
Displays a list of all current and completed quests, levequests, and company missions. From this list, objectives and locations can be confirmed, and duty can be abandoned.
Displays time remaining for various duties such as allied society dailies and levequest allowance allotment.
Displays a list of in-game achievements, as well as the conditions for obtaining them.
Displays information on items previously gathered, as well as mining and logging locations categorized by area.
Displays a list of hunting objectives for Disciples of War and Magic. Information on monster habitat, kills recorded, and experience earned is also available.
Opens the crafting interface from which you can select items to synthesize.
Displays a list of all crystals and items in your inventory. From this list, items can be equipped, used, discarded, or sorted.
Displays a list of items used only in specific quests. If a quest is abandoned, all key items associated with it will be discarded.
Displays a list of your current party members. From this list you can change member order, and if you are leader, kick other players or dissolve the party altogether.
Displays a list of players on your friend list. From this list you can send /tell messages or invite players to a party.
Displays a list of players you have added to your blacklist. Not only will their characters and messages be hidden, but they will be unable to trade with you or invite you to parties.
Search for other players using variables such as name, class, level, and online status.

Opens the map of your current location. Maps contain information on party members, aetherytes, shops, guilds, and quest destinations. Maps can also be zoomed in or out, or swapped with region or world maps.
Displays a list of available emote commands which can be executed from the list, or set to your hotbar.
Mark targets with various different signs to make them easier for party and alliance members to distinguish.
Adjust system-related settings such as graphics, sound, <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(75),0))>controller<Else/>gamepad</If> functionality, and more.
Map various in-game functions to your keyboard to better suit your play style.
Create and save multi-step macros to execute complex commands with a single button press. Macros can be assigned icons and set to your hotbar for easy access.
Adjust the location, size, and display status of all user-interface components and save them to templates.
Log out and return to the title screen.
Log out and exit the game.
Displays gear stored in your Armoury Chest. All gear obtained is automatically moved to the chest and sorted by type. From here it can be equipped, repaired, or returned to your inventory.
Opens the Free Company interface, where you can access company information, view and leave messages, and execute company commands.
Displays a list of all linkshell members for all your linkshells.
Displays information on your previous catches, as well as fishing hole locations categorized by area.
Displays a list of all previously viewed active help tutorials.
Displays a list of nearby quests and duties currently available.
Search for answers to frequently asked questions, report issues, and confirm messages from the FINAL FANTASY XIV support team.
Discover and join solo and party-based duties such as instanced raids and guildhests without having to gather a party yourself.
Adjust character-related settings such as camera type, targeting functionality, hotbar commands, and chat log preferences.
Instantly travel to any aetheryte to which you have previously attuned. A fee will be collected upon your arrival.
Instantly return to your current home point (or dungeon starting point). No aetheryte usage fee is required, but you can only use the spell once every 15 minutes (Earth time).
Displays the FINAL FANTASY XIV end user license agreement.
（ヘルプ無し）
（ヘルプ無し）
（ヘルプ無し）
Displays details on all the fish you have caught, where you caught them, as well as your personal records.
Displays information on your summonable companions, including level, class, and available actions.
（ヘルプ無し）
Opens the Housing interface, where you can view and manage your estate.
Adjust display settings such as screen mode and resolution.
Adjust various sound settings such as music and effects volume, and listening position.
Adjust various graphics settings in order to optimize performance on your system.
Adjust various mouse settings such as camera sensitivity.
Adjust various <If(GreaterThan(PlayerParameter(75),0))>controller<Else/>gamepad</If> settings such as vibration.
Adjust miscellaneous settings such as screenshot format and cutscene language.
Adjust various control settings such as movement and targeting.
Adjust various UI settings such as HUD layout.
Adjust various settings pertaining to the information displayed above each character.
Adjust various settings for the hotbar.
Adjust various log window settings such as font size and log filters.
View PvP information for your character such as rank and performance records, and set PvP actions to your hotbars.
Find and recruit party members based on the specified conditions.
Place markers to guide your party and alliance members to a destination.
Confirm the readiness of other party and/or alliance members.

Displays a list of challenges that you can undertake. Information on progress and rewards is also available. Progress in each category is reset every <ResetTime>1203</ResetTime><Switch(TopLevelParameter(220))><Case(1)>Sunday</Case><Case(2)>Monday</Case><Case(3)>Tuesday</Case><Case(4)>Wednesday</Case><Case(5)>Thursday</Case><Case(6)>Friday</Case><Case(7)>Saturday</Case></Switch> at <If(TopLevelParameter(218))><Switch(TopLevelParameter(218))><Case(1)>1</Case><Case(2)>2</Case><Case(3)>3</Case><Case(4)>4</Case><Case(5)>5</Case><Case(6)>6</Case><Case(7)>7</Case><Case(8)>8</Case><Case(9)>9</Case><Case(10)>10</Case><Case(11)>11</Case><Case(12)>12</Case><Case(13)>1</Case><Case(14)>2</Case><Case(15)>3</Case><Case(16)>4</Case><Case(17)>5</Case><Case(18)>6</Case><Case(19)>7</Case><Case(20)>8</Case><Case(21)>9</Case><Case(22)>10</Case><Case(23)>11</Case></Switch><Else/>12</If> <If(GreaterThanOrEqualTo(TopLevelParameter(218),12))>p.m.<Else/>a.m.</If> (Earth time).
Displays detailed information on the mounts you have acquired.
Displays detailed information on the minions you have collected.
Adjust various gameplay and UI settings to make the game easier to hear, see, and use.
Displays information on sightseeing vistas.

Displays various information pertaining to the Gold Saucer, including MGP in possession, Cactpot draw times, Triple Triad tournament results, personal deck makeup, Lord of Verminion hotbar and Doman mahjong settings, and race chocobo status.
Displays information on all currencies in possession.
Displays attunement information for aether currents.
Opens a menu granting access to the official FINAL FANTASY XIV website, the Lodestone.
Displays information on orchestrion rolls obtained.
Grants entrance to the Hall of the Novice and access to their regimen of training exercises designed to teach new Disciples of War and Magic the basics of combat for tank, healer, and DPS roles.
Adjust various item and inventory settings.
Challenge the latest high-level raids. Adjustable search settings allow for solo players or parties under the minimum member requirements to be matched with players with the same goals.
Set and display a numerical countdown visible by all party and alliance members.
Displays a list of players with whom you have most recently partied. Players on the list can be added to your friend list.
Displays mount movement speed for every area.
View recorded duties and adjust Duty Recorder settings.
Displays a list of all items in your chocobo saddlebag. From this list, items can be transferred to your inventory, or that of a retainer. Cannot be accessed while participating in instanced duties.
Displays information on your PvP team.
Confirm the readiness of other party and/or alliance members before recording a duty. Can only be used while on a recordable duty.
Create cross-world linkshells, confirm cross-world linkshell status, and invite players to join cross-world parties.
Displays all learned blue magic spells. Here, spells can be added to and removed from your Active Actions.
Assemble a party of phantasmal NPC allies to challenge instanced dungeons.
Select a color scheme for the UI.
Displays progress for shared FATEs in applicable regions, including rank and number of FATEs completed with the highest rating possible.
Create fellowships and confirm fellowship status.
View a list of fellowships currently recruiting members and join them.
Displays items of interest gathered during your adventures.
Replay your favorite quests at your current level.
Displays a list of available fashion accessories.
Displays a list of official sites for FINAL FANTASY XIV.
Assemble a party of NPC supporters to challenge instanced dungeons.
View your portrait gallery or edit portraits for each of your gear sets.
Edit the appearance and content of your profile to share with other adventurers.
Join variant and criterion dungeons, and adjust dungeon settings. View entries for story elements discovered in variant dungeons.
Select the type and style of facewear to be equipped by your character.
Displays a list of players you have added to your mute list. Messages from these characters will be hidden.
Displays a list of words added to the Term Filter. From this list you can add, remove, or edit terms to be filtered from the chat log.
